Campus Events
October 2021 Event
The Strategic Plan implementation committees presented goals that have been accomplished
                        to date and additional progress forthcoming during the Strategic Plan Showcase, held
                        Oct. 26 from noon to 2 p.m. on Centennial Walkway.
                     
About 54 percent of all goals have been accomplished under the strategic plan. Some
                        of the many new initiatives developed or launched under the strategic plan include
                        the following:
                     

Nine new proposals have been developed for new collaborative research centers, with
                           an additional four projected by May 2023.
                        
SDSU Imperial Valley is now offering the four-year liberal studies degree to high
                           school graduates, a Bachelor of Arts in mathematics to transfer students and is also
                           serving the university’s first cohort of graduate students in the Master of Science
                           degree program in homeland security.
                        
A new Climate Action Plan for the SDSU is under development and a new senior sustainability
                           officer will be hired by the year’s end to help lead universitywide sustainability
                           initiatives.
                        
A new San Diego-Imperial Valley shuttle service is being piloted to more easily connect
                           the SDSU and SDSU Imperial Valley campuses and to facilitate shared academic, research,
                           and student engagement activities across both campuses.
                        
The Basic Needs & Wellness Toolkit for faculty, staff and student leaders has been
                           implemented to promote and educate students about counseling, economic crisis support
                           and overall wellness.
                        
SDSU has received federal designation as an Asian American and Native American Pacific
                           Islander-Serving Institution (AANAPISI).
                        
Eight heritage month celebrations were held in 2020 and 10 more are being held this
                           year.
                        
Several mural projects have been introduced on campus, including several as part of
                           the Social Justice Mural Project at Art North, and one at the Black Resource Center
                           by internationally renowned graffiti artist Maxx Moses.
                        

October 2019 Events
The Strategic Planning Steering Committee is hosting a live forum that on October
                        3, 2019, from 3 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. at Scripps Cottage. This session is open to all
                        students, faculty, staff, alumni and community members who would like to attend. No
                        RSVP is necessary.
                     
The Strategic Planning Steering Committee is also hosting a series of pop-up events
                        to share information and gather feedback as part of the strategic planning process.
                        The events are as follows:
                     
Faculty-Staff Club - Outside Club
Tuesday, October 1, from 11:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.Wednesday, October 2, from 11:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.Thursday, October 3, from 11:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.
                     
Library (North Library by the Free Speech Wall)
Tuesday, October 1, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.Wednesday, October 2, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.Thursday, October 3, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.
                     
ARC - Outside Main Entrance
Tuesday, October 1, from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.Wednesday, October 2, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.Thursday, October 3, from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.
                     
East Commons - Outside Market
Tuesday, October 1, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.Wednesday, October 2, from 11 a.m. to. 2 p.m.Thursday, October 3, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.
Strategic Planning Kickoff and Group Discussion Sessions
San Diego State University is embarking on a strategic planning process that will
                        define the vision and direction of the University for the next five years and more.
                        We need your input, insights, and feedback to identify the strategic priorities for
                        the campus over this timeframe. Learn more about the overall timeline for the three
                        planning phases by visiting the Timeline and Updates page.
                     
The campus community is invited to attend the kickoff event for San Diego State University’s
                        Strategic Plan, to be held Monday, September 23, from 8:15 to 9 a.m. in Montezuma
                        Hall of the Conrad Prebys Aztec Student Union.
                     
Speakers include: SDSU President Adela de la Torre; Salvador Hector Ochoa, Provost
                        and Senior Vice President; J. Luke Wood, SDSU Chief Diversity Officer; University
                        Senate Chair Mark Wheeler; and Associated Students President Christian Onwuka.
                     
The community is also welcome to attend and everyone is encouraged to register to participate for at least one of the discussion groups being offered over a three-day period,
                        Monday, September 23, through Wednesday, September 25. If you would like to participate
                        during the kickoff event or group discussion sessions and require specific accommodations,
                        please email [email protected]. Additional campus and community opportunities will be scheduled throughout the planning
                        process to gather input.
